intro: Astracantha baghensis, commonly known as the Kashmir rose, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically arranged in a compact cluster. This species is often found in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions.
